Legal_Issue: Did the Officer err in assessing Mr. Rocha's degree of establishment and hardship evidence under H&C grounds?
Evidence_Assessment: Mr. Rocha provided evidence of his establishment in Canada and hardship due to medical care unavailability and discrimination in the Philippines. The Officer found insufficient hardship.
Legal_Rule: Section 25(1) of IRPA allows H&C exemptions for foreign nationals facing unusual or disproportionate hardship if required to apply for permanent residence from abroad.
Grounds_for_Claim: Hardship due to lack of medical care and discrimination in the Philippines, establishment in Canada
Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence of establishment in Canada, medical care unavailability in the Philippines, experiences of discrimination
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to refusal of H&C application based on hardship claims
Claimant_Status: Foreign national applying for permanent residency
Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds application process
